comments:
Currently I cannot refresh some project because I alwas get an error dialog titled "Refresh Problems" with the message "Reason: Could not read metadata for: ..." and then some long path pointing to my workspace's .metadata/.pluins/org.eclipse.core.resources/.projects folder, with details error "java.io.EOFException". 

Previously I was unable to delete some files from that project with a similar error message. So I went and deleted them outside Eclipse, and now I'm getting this error.

Here's the refresh error from the Error Log:

Workaround: deleting the project form workspace (without deleting its contents) and re-importing it.

You don't still have a log containing the previous error message by any chance? Regardless of how you got into this state, we should have better recovery code here to prevent the exception from recurring. I have released a minor fix whereby we don't abort the refresh local when this kind of problem occurs.

Created an attachment (id=52133)
